item.title: Cain & Abel
item.description: Genesis 4:1-15 describes the infamous story of Cain and Abel. In this story, two brothers, Cain (a “tiller of the ground”) and Abel (a “keeper of flocks”), bring a sacrifice before God (see Genesis 4:2-3). Verses three and four tell us that Cain brings “an offering of the fruit of the ground” and Abel brings “the firstlings of his flock and their fat portions”. The end of verse four and beginning of verse five reads: “And the LORD had regard for Abel and for his offering; but for Cain and for his offering He had no regard.
